column1: Required: Name of the data file this variable is in
column2: Required: Name of the variable as formatted in the dataset or database
column3: Required: Label for the variable name formatted nicely for clarity, used in data exports from databases for eg.
column4: Required. Categorical, integer, numeric (floating point), String (character)
column5: Recommended: Reserved for URL or URI that identifies the term and it's definition in a controlled vocabulary or ontology. If one doesn't exist see this documentation [TODO: add link]
column6: Required if no 'URL of Variable Definition' is given. The definition of the term, along with the source of the definition if available.
column7: Recommended. Provide either a URI to a definition or describe free text the method of measurement or determination
column8: Recommended where measurement has units: Use a unit of measurement listed in the NVS: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P06/current/
column9: Recommended where measurement has units: Use the URI of the specifiic unit of measurement from http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P06/current/
column10: Recommended if the variable is a categorical variable. Can be a comma seperated list or a URI to a controlled vocabulary

column6: "The LRP represents the stock status, usually in terms of biomass (or abundance), below which “serious harm” to the stock  may be incurred. In Canada and elsewhere, serious harm is considered to include recruitment  overfishing or other impairment to productive capacity." Defined in XYZ source citation Holtby et al..
